#Text=Spain sits near the bottom of OECD rankings on adult literacy and numeracy
#Text=Thursday , October 10 , 2013
#Text=Members of the OECD Image : Canuckguy and Emuzesto .

#Text=Tuesday , the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development ( OECD ) , a 34 member international economic organization founded in 1961 that traces its origins back to the World War II -era Marshall Plan , published results on the state of adult skills in 24 countries , most of them European .
#Text=Spain
#Text=finished near the bottom of all surveyed countries when it came to adult literacy and numeracy .
#Text=Internationally , Spain ranks second to last amongst surveyed countries for literacy proficiency amongst adults .
#Text=Only Italy has a lower literacy proficiency amongst adults .
#Text=Spain , at 20.3 % , has one of the highest percentages of their population at reading proficiency level 1 .
#Text=This means adults have a basic understanding of what they read , can fill out forms , and can understand the meaning of sentences .
#Text=When below level 1 is added , the total comes to 27.5 % of the population at the lowest reading proficiency level .
#Text=Overall , Spain 's mean reading proficiency score puts them on par with Italy .
#Text=Amongst young adults aged 16 to 24 years , Spain ranks second to last amongst surveyed countries , with a mean score comparable to Italy , England , and Northern Ireland , and Cyprus .
#Text=Spain ranks last amongst all surveyed countries in numeracy proficiency amongst adults aged 16 to 65 years .
#Text=The country 's mean score is comparable to Italy .
#Text=When only 16 to 24 year-olds are included , Spain 's overall relative performance increases by two spots , as a result of beating out Italy and the United States .
#Text=The performance of this age group is comparable to Ireland , Italy , England and Northern Ireland .
#Text=Individual performance on numeracy and literacy correlates highly in Spain at 0.887 .

#Text=The percentage of adults who have completed university in Spain is slightly under the global average for people aged 25 to 34 years , and significantly below average for people aged 55 to 65 years .
#Text=Spain finishes near the bottom of surveyed countries based on reading skills required at work .
#Text=Only the Czech Republic , Slovakia , Poland , and Italy require less use of reading skills at work .
#Text=In 2010 , roughly 50 % of people in Spain had access to the Internet .
#Text=From 2005 to 2010 , there was an increase from around 25 % to around 35 % in the number of individuals using the Internet to interact with government in Spain .
#Text=In the same period , business interaction with governments in Spain increased from about 55 % to about 65 % .
#Text=Spain 's percentage of foreign-born residents rose from around 3 % in 1995 to about 14 % in 2009 .

#Text=The results are based on a survey of 166,000 adults from Australia , Austria , Flanders , Canada , the Czech Republic , Denmark , Estonia , Finland , France , Germany , Ireland , Italy , Japan , South Korea , the Netherlands , Norway , Poland , Slovakia , Spain , Sweden , England , Northern Ireland , the United States , Cyprus , and Russia .
#Text=They survey was conducted from August 2011 to March 2012 , with the exceptions of Canada where data was colected from November 2011 to June 2012 , and France from September to November 2012 .
